title: Vocabulary: Prefixes and Suffixes

vocab.kid_friendly_definition: A word part added to the beginning of a root word to change its meaning.
A word part added to the end of a root word to change its meaning.
The main part of a word that contains the basic meaning.
A word you can add prefixes or suffixes to.
A prefix or suffix added to a word.
Two words joined together to make a new word, like sunflower.

teachingNotes: Explain that prefixes and suffixes are like building blocks for words. Use charts and examples to show how common affixes like 'un-', 're-', '-ful,' and '-less' change a root word's meaning.

sample.question: What does the prefix 'un-' mean in the word 'unhappy'?
What does the suffix '-ful' mean in the word 'careful'?
What is the root word in 'replay'?
Add a prefix to the word 'possible' to make it mean the opposite.
What does the prefix 'pre-' mean in the word 'preview'?
What suffix can you add to 'teach' to make it a person who teaches?
What does the prefix 'dis-' mean in the word 'disagree'?

truefalse.question: A prefix comes at the beginning of a word.
A suffix comes at the end of a word.
The prefix 're-' means to do something again.
The prefix 'un-' often changes a word to its opposite meaning.
Root words cannot stand alone as their own word.
The suffix '-er' can mean 'more' (like in 'taller') or 'a person who does something' (like in 'teacher').
